page.title: 01LEAFIELD AND AREA.
page.content: The block covers an area between Burford and Witney, Oxfordshire;mainly farms and minor roads.Springs and quarries abound. 1.Leafield.The village to the north east was called Field Town.It was a clearing in the Wychwood Forest,famous for poaching,gloving and pottery. Approximately 800 inhabitants enjoy the following amenitites:primary school, church, chapel, three pubs,shop,post office,butcher,bus service to Witney. 2.Fordwells,a hamlet to the south east where people once drew their water. 3.Field Assarts,a hamlet "assarted" from the forest.4.Leafield Radio Station,owned by Telecom International. Historically,Langley Farm has connections with King John and Queen Elizabeth 1.Southlawn,to the west,has connections with the Mitfords.Tumuli, barrows and earthworks exist.
